hash-onion.description: Create hash onions to be used by the forger.

count.name: count
count.description: Total number of hashes to produce

pretty.name: pretty
pretty.description: Prints JSON in pretty format rather than condensed.

data-path.name: data-path
data-path.description: Directory path to specify where node data is stored. Environment variable "PHAETON_DATA_PATH" can also be used.

network.name: network
network.description: Default network config to use. Environment variable "PHAETON_NETWORK" can also be used.

config.name: config
config.description: File path to a custom config. Environment variable "PHAETON_CONFIG_FILE" can also be used.

overwrite-config.name: overwrite-config
overwrite-config.description: Overwrite network configs if they exist already

port.name: port
port.description: Open port for the peer to peer incoming connections. Environment variable "PHAETON_PORT" can also be used.

api-ipc.name: api-ipc
api-ipc.description: Enable IPC communication. This will also load up plugins in child process and communicate over IPC.

api-ws-port.name: api-ws-port
api-ws-port.description: Port to be used for api-client websocket.

console-log.name: console-log
console-log.description: Console log level. Environment variable "PHAETON_CONSOLE_LOG_LEVEL" can also be used.

log.name: log
log.description: File log level. Environment variable "PHAETON_FILE_LOG_LEVEL" can also be used.

seed-peers.name: seed-peers
seed-peers.description: Seed peers to initially connect to in format of comma separated "ip:port". IP can be DNS name or IPV4 format. Environment variable "PHAETON_SEED_PEERS" can also be used.

enable-http-api-plugin.name: enable-http-api-plugin
enable-http-api-plugin.description: Enable HTTP API Plugin. Environment variable "PHAETON_ENABLE_HTTP_API_PLUGIN" can also be used.

http-api-plugin-port.name: http-api-plugin-port
http-api-plugin-port.description: Port to be used for HTTP API Plugin. Environment variable "PHAETON_HTTP_API_PLUGIN_PORT" can also be used.

http-api-plugin-whitelist.name: http-api-plugin-whitelist
http-api-plugin-whitelist.description: List of IPs in comma separated value to allow the connection. Environment variable "PHAETON_HTTP_API_PLUGIN_WHITELIST" can also be used.

enable-forger-plugin.name: enable-forger-plugin
enable-forger-plugin.description: Enable Forger Plugin. Environment variable "PHAETON_ENABLE_FORGER_PLUGIN" can also be used.

enable-monitor-plugin.name: enable-monitor-plugin
enable-monitor-plugin.description: Enable Monitor Plugin. Environment variable "PHAETON_ENABLE_MONITOR_PLUGIN" can also be used.

monitor-plugin-port.name: monitor-plugin-port
monitor-plugin-port.description: Port to be used for Monitor Plugin. Environment variable "PHAETON_MONITOR_PLUGIN_PORT" can also be used.

monitor-plugin-whitelist.name: monitor-plugin-whitelist
monitor-plugin-whitelist.description: List of IPs in comma separated value to allow the connection. Environment variable "PHAETON_MONITOR_PLUGIN_WHITELIST" can also be used.

enable-report-misbehavior-plugin.name: enable-report-misbehavior-plugin
enable-report-misbehavior-plugin.description: Enable ReportMisbehavior Plugin. Environment variable "PHAETON_ENABLE_REPORT_MISBEHAVIOR_PLUGIN" can also be used.
